comment: Potent yet refined. Added six drops of water to open the flavor and immediately enjoyed the smooth oak flavor. Had great conversation around Scotch and the Scotland distilling process. For the money, worth it.
Not too strong but not too light. Smooth.   Added 3 drops of water.
Smooth single malt with a nice oaky undertone from the time in bourbon barrels.

A- golden
N- raisin, toffee, vanilla, floral
T-  vanilla & oak, honey, hint of peat
F- short but hint of smoke sticks around
Sweet light aroma. Very thin body, almost no tail. Minimal alcohol burn as well, mostly grain flavor with some sweetness from the bourbon barrels.
Overall good. Light with a bourbon taste short finish. Light smoke on the nose
Nothing special, medium flavors and quick to leave.
Love the gentle bourbon finish...makes it super clean
A little smokier than I expected for a Highland.  Very enjoyable. Great value.
Nice bourbon notes, with just the right amount of peat on the finish.  Probably a good starter bottle for beginning drinkers.

I found this to be just ok.  It has a very fruity type finish on the end.  Almost like the taste of a pear.  Not enough bite or smokiness for me.  Would I drink it again....yea.  Would I buy it again...no.
Vanilla hits the palette first with fruit and floral notes through the middle and finishes like a bourbon with a perfect amount of peat at the finish.  Great deal for the money.
Finished in a bourbon cask. Good taste for the price
Sweet vanilla start with mid peach burn and slight peat finish.
Chocolate!!!  A little smoke. Positive surprised.

This is my first ever scotch. I really don't know what I'm treating. Had a great smell of the bourbon cask. I get a very slight bit of vanilla. Since I'm used to beer, the alcohol burn is pretty noticeable.
Bourbon quality, peanuts, cashews, dark chocolate, raspberries.
I really like this. Wow. Has the distinctive features of scotch but finishes like a really good bourbon. Love this very much.
Scotch bite with some minor mellowing from bourbon sweetness.
Subtle smoke, a little warm, fairly approachable.
Better than expected. High taste/price ratio.

The nose started super sweet then, over about 15 minutes, transitioned through stewed prunes, sugar cookies, burnt toffee and vanilla, the palate is smooth and creamy with light butterscotch and vanilla, there’s a little smoky wood on the medium finish
I like the oak and vanilla in this one. Tastes like bourbon, but smoother. Nice for the money.

Mladá nevyzrálá whiska bez výraznějšího konce
Poměr cena/výkon

Smooth and easy to sip. May not be the most sophisticated scotch out there, but enough flavor to make it interesting. Little to no peat or smoke. 

A week ago I would have said I don’t like scotch, and would stick to bourbon. This was enjoyable enough to change my mind.
It's okay.  Not a huge fan of bourbon finished single malts though.

No water
Takes a few sips to become smooth 
Nothing stands out
Dull

Nose: oak, vanilla, citrus
Taste: vanilla, oak, Carmel, smooth
Finish: short, no burn
This is pretty good for what I am assume is a very young whisky. Probably a good buy for the money. Reminds me a lot of Rebel Yell Bourbon. Lots of bourbon character with no trace of corn sweetness.

Very drinkable, lacks complexity, could use more age but that would increase the price. QPR is good for this entry level scotch. Enjoy neat or with a single cube, but don’t get carried away. It will work as a filler in between the more refined options. It’s a scotch that wishes it was a bourbon, the spicy heat of an American bourbon with just a puff of smoke to let you know it’s a scotch. Buy
smoky aroma. sweet sip, slow burn with spicy but not bad after burn

On the nose, a lot of oak spice. Cherry and dark chocolate as well. 

Taste wise, Cherry and Dark chocolate continue to have a large presence. Oak as well. Also hints of apple. 

Finish is a little rough. Lot of ethanol and burn at the end. 

Solid whiskey.
Very smooth with nice flavors. It borders on the too sweet side for me. I can enjoy one dram at a time and then I’m done.
Smell-musty red wine. Taste-can taste the bourbon. And something else but I can't place it
Fairly light with faint burn on the nose, hints of cinnamon and Carmel with a short finish.
I'm not much for scotch. But this is super smooth!

Nose - baking spice, hint of honey, light smoke
Taste - hot, bit of spice, barrel char, burned butter
Finish - lingering burn, fairly thin though
Pleasant but not overpowering bourbon character. I’d buy it if it was cheaper than Glenfiddich 14.
The bourbon adds a bold tone. Flavors of apple and caramel at the finish.
A sweet nose with hints of caramel, light crisp apple at first taste, and finish sweet
Outstanding single malt for the price. Easy daily drinker.

Nose: Pleasant
Palate: Bit of burn on the way down
